flawed_nl_solution:
The discount is 45*0.2=$<<45*0.2=9>>9 off each pair
So she pays 45-9= $<<45-9=36>>36 each
So it will cost 36*10=$<<36*10=360>>360 before tax
The tax will add 360*0.1=$<<360*0.1=36>>36
So she has to pay 360+36=$<<360+36=398>>398
#### 398

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 396, not 398. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
